alert.note: Alert for Fountain; Parke; Vermillion; Warren (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 11:02AM EST until January 30 at 8:12PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... Wabash River. .Lowland flooding is developing along the upper Wabash from a combination of previous precipitation, snowmelt and additional rainfall on still frozen ground. Expected minor flooding could be made worse by any ice jams that develop as river ice breaks up with the warmer temperatures and moves downstream. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Covington. * WHEN...From this evening to Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Five Crossings, a local county river park at old U.S. Highway 136 bridge site, begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM EST Thursday the stage was 15.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 18.8 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued late tonight by around 215 AM EST.
